caption: Delicious pizza, my new bay ridge favorite.
Subpar pizza and they don’t carry Coca Cola

The crust makes Espresso's pizza top-notch.  The red sauce is very good and the ingredients always fresh.  Great lentil soup (when they have it) and good heroes.  Quick delivery, too.  My favorite in Bay Ridge.
Regular slice the way I remembered it as a kid. The Margarita slice is amazing. Great neighborhood establishment, owner is always quick to welcome you.
simply the best
Best pizza in NYC!!

I have no clue who is giving this place 5 stars.  It's not bad but its miles and miles and galaxies away from ninos and vesuvios and pretty much every other pizza place in the neighborhood.   I think it gets good rating because it's close to the army base and to be honest,  alot of these people aren't from NY and I'm sorry but they dont know what they are missing. Want a hidden gem of a pizza spot? Go down the road to Philadelphia grill. Classic oldschool Brooklyn style pizza.

i wouldn't go quite so far as to say i "dislike it," it's more like i'm stuck smack dab in the middle of a smack down situation of my own making . . . how . . . tedious . . . and, of course it's all ABOUT &$@&'**":-&&!!! PIZZA!!!!!!!!  i'll have to get bakatcha on this, . . . right now, i gutta go pay up(+tip . . . oy veh . . . ) to the pizza delivery guy . . . .  LATAH GATAH zip!!!!!
Their pizza is simply the best!
Best pizza and chicken parm in the neighborhood!
this pizza is sooooo good. Totally recomended. It might be high in price but it gives an amazing taste. The quality is so good.

I'm a nurse from Ohio who just started working at the VA for a travel assignment. My 5 week old daughter is in MA with my wife and other family members. On the way home I thought I'd get some pizza to help cheer me up because I'm missing my wife and daughter already (it's going to be a long travel assignment). I don't know the name of the older gentlemen with glasses who put my two slices of pizza in the oven and then proceeded to give them to me for FREE, but it was much appreciated guesture for this lonely nurse. Thank you sir, thank you very much.
Crispy thin with no flop, classic brooklyn slice top 5 on my list.
Consistently good pizza, clean, owner and staff are cool people

i miss working in bay ridge, because on my way to work, i would stop by espresso pizzeria all the time and grab two slices and a can of soda. this place is your typical neighborhood pizzeria. not aesthetically the best looking place, but i would not have it any other way. when i think of the perfect slice, this place will always come to mind. cheese and sauce ratio is perfect. their crust is arguably the best ive had.  whenever my friends ask me where the best slice i've ever had is, i always tell them, "there's this little pizzeria in bay ridge by staples".
Pizza that tastes like pizza. Worth the trip to the end of the R.
Great Brooklyn pizza....old school feel, good price, nice people.
Simple. Delicious!

the pizza is delicious and the staff treats the neighborhood like family. enjoy them hot or at room temperature. tastes like the best ingredients are used and the crust is always crispy. dont forget to grab the perfect slice when you get off the R on 92nd
Excellent pizza

Tasty pizza but i didn't like the fact that the older gentleman at the counter told me there's only ONE slice left. (I wanted 2) mind you, its only 6:30pm...  instead why not just give me what i want if i agreed to wait 5 minutes (or whatever) until the next pie was made??? So strange.
Low Key pizza place but great taste. The quality is consistantly good. I have never seen more than 2-3 pizza on the display which means that they are fresh. Must try this place.

Walked in to this classic, dim lit, old style Pizza Joint. Guy making Pizza has a white beard, and a full head of white hair. He was polite... And his Pizza was delicious! A classic Brooklyn style Pizza. Priced Right and made well. Only issue, no bathroom and no place to wash my hands.
Best pizza in NY!
Small pizza place but great pizza and customer service
Best NY style pizza in the area
Love it here. My favorite pizza in Brooklyn.

One of Bay Ridge's best pizzerias. A prime example of the old axiom that an eatery which keeps a shorter menu does all of its offerings well, as opposed to having a long menu with just average results. Dont expect a long list of exotic  specialty pizzas, just the basics. And dont expect fancy decor. This is a classic Brooklyn pizzeria...simple, clean...not fancy. The owner, Tony, is a neighborhood treasure, he's always friendly and willing to shoot the breeze, if ur a regular he knows u by name, what u do for work, and what's going on in ur life. Ask to see his historic Bay Ridge street map, which shows the original street names before the boring number system was instituted.
Fast and damn good! Very friendly to kids!
Absolutely love this place! I go there at least twice a week n the pizza is out of the world!!!
I moved to Philadelphia, my husband has business trips to Ft. Hamilton army base. I come along and ALWAYS get a slice of pizza for lunch and get hero's to go! Eggplant parm is my favorite!
Absolutely fantastic slice. None better in South Brooklyn.
New York pizza, for New Yorkers.
This food is amazing
One of the best "plain" pizzas you'll ever have.  You go here not for the decour, but to grab a couple of slices, or eat a whole pie with a friend.
Great pizza...
Love this place! Awesome food and fabulous customer service!!!
Tiny hole in the wall with amazing margarita pizza. Fantastic and inexpensive - call ahead and get a pie to go.
Great pizza and lentil soup.
Top pizza in bay ridge.
Awesome
DELICIOUS!! Definitely deserves more than 4 stars. Very friendly too.
One of the last true nyc pizza places left. Amazing every time

The place is a hidden gem . I’m very particular about my pizza and I have to say it is by far one of the best Margarita’s in NYC!  The sauce is amazingly fresh and the crust is crisp and thin . Not too heavy and very affordable!
Best Pizza in Bay Ridge

This is hands down the best pizza dare i say in Brooklyn! Yes I said it !!! Tony has been feeding me and my family for over 20yrs the pizza is PIZZA old school pizza nothing more nothing less it's actually pizza ! I now live in bensonhurst and travel for his pizza ! Keep it up Tony
Real deal Brooklyn pizza here.

Most authentic pizza in NY! This took me back to the first time I tried pizza. Definitely comfort, feel good food. Crust is crispy and flaky. Not oily or greasy. Cheese is fresh and plentiful. Sauce is authentic and spices are perfect. The restaurant itself is very clean with great customer service. A large classic pizza is only $15. This place cannot be beat! Perfecto!
Espresso Pizzaria has the best 🍕 in all of Brooklyn! Forget the rest and take trip on the R train out to Bayridge (last stop 95th) to get the best slice of heaven!
I visited this restaurant with my family a few times.  I only had the pizza and it's pretty tasty.
Descent
Here is the best Pizzeria I've never been
Pizza was okay, after being in the oven A few minutes pizza was cold all inside
Great hero's.
I love it
Best kept secret in the area. Reasonable price, excellent product and great service.
Will hit the highway for this delicious pizza & I live on the tip of Queens!
Best pizza out there! It's a family go to when we visit the city!
Great pizza by great people
My go-to place for pizza. Great crust and friendly staff. The dough is so good that I buy it from them sometimes and make my own pizza at home.
Best pizza in the neighborhood HooaH!!!!!
Didn't start eating this pizza til about a year ago.....but definitely great pizza!!!About 250' from my front door too! Tony is a old school pizza man!
So so pizza. Terrible, uninterested service. Better pizza to be had nearby.
crispy. I love to eat the crispy part of pizza but lots of places don't know how to make it easy to chew. However the pizza this place serves is not dried out and it is tasty.
Good pizza! I was skeptical, since the place is tiny and doesn't look like much, but the two slices I had were like typical Brooklyn pizza, and the toppings were abundant.

If you've ever wondered what a true bare bones Brooklyn pizza joint looked like, Espresso Pizzeria is the place (Formerly Gabriella Pizza on 92nd and Fort Hamilton parkway). This guy has been making pizza for over 30 years and has kept up with the franchises that have made their way into the neighborhood. I grew up on this pizza and it's the only place we ever ordered from. There is no website, no Twitter, and no Facebook filler stuff here because he doesn't focus on marketing or social media because evidently the pizza speaks for itself. You're not getting grandma slices and buffalo chicken pizza at a place like this. Espresso solely focuses on serving NY style pizza that is true and traditional from its crust to its core.
Probably, one of the best pizzas I ever tried. Just enough of everything on it and with thin crust. Place itself is nothing really to look at.

So many NYers have their favorite places to get a slice. Few take the time, attention to the details, and insistence on high-end ingredients to ensure a perfect slice time after time. Tony is one such artisan of pizza. Never compromising on the closely guarded secret ingredients he uses (including blends of high-end cheeses) to craft bite after delicious bite of this NY staple. A well kept secret, even within BayRidge, the locals who know, KNOW. Artistry, integrity, and a sense of investment with each pie he creates. Expresso beats many of the more "famous" or "best" pizza slices in the city.
